plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub known for its glossy leaves and beautiful, rose-like flowers that bloom in late fall through winter. Commonly cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, native to East Asia (Japan, Korea, China)
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers were prized by Victorian gardeners and symbolize admiration and perfection.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial plant flowering in midwinter, often near Christmas, known for its white or pinkish blooms that brighten shady garden spots.
plants.location: Alpine regions of Europe, cultivated in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, the Christmas Rose is not a true rose and can bloom through snow.

plants.name: Grevillea rosmarinifolia
plants.description: A native Australian shrub that blooms sporadically year-round, with heightened flowering in winter, producing spider-like flowers attractive to birds.
plants.bloomingSeason: Winter to early spring (June to September in Southern Hemisphere)
plants.location: Eastern Australia, cultivated in similar climates worldwide
plants.funFact: Grevilleas are known for their unique flower structure adapted for bird pollination.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub that flowers in mild winter climates, producing clusters of fragrant flowers commonly found in Mediterranean and subtropical gardens.
plants.bloomingSeason: May to December (can bloom year-round in frost-free areas)
plants.location: Mediterranean, southern USA, and subtropical/tropical regions
plants.funFact: Oleander is highly toxic if ingested but widely used as an ornamental plant due to its beauty and drought tolerance.
